alert.note: Alert for Cabarrus (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 09 at 9:00AM EDT until April 13 at 8:51AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by runoff from recent excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of piedmont North Carolina, including the following county, Cabarrus. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...High flow and near bankfull conditions on the Rocky River and its tributaries. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 855 AM EDT, a stream gauge on the Rocky River above Irish Buffalo Creek indicated the river had fallen below flood stage. However, high flow and near bankfull conditions will continue on the river and its tributaries into the afternoon. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain fell over Cabarrus County on the 7th and 8th of April. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Downtown Concord, West Concord, Harrisburg, Mt Pleasant and Charlotte Motor Speedway. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
